com.skysql.monitor
Class node

java.lang.Object
  com.skysql.monitor.node
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class node
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The node interface in the monitor. Each instance of a node represents a database that is being monitored. This class provides a mechanism to connect to the monitored database, a means to execute SQL on that database and basic reachability tests for the node. Node connections are implemented as threads in order not to delay the execution of the main monitor.

Author:
Mark Riddoch

Method Detail

close

public void close()
Close the connection to the monitored database

connect

private void connect()
Connect to the monitored database. A new thread will be created to establish the connection, if a connection already exists, or a connection thread is running, then another connection will not be made to the database.

run

public void run()
The connection thread entry point. This method gets called on the connection thread and will create the connection and then terminate the thread

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

fetchTable

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fetchTable(java.lang.String sql)
Execute a SQL statement that will return a result set with two columns and multiple rows. The result set is mapped into a Java HashMap with the first column treated as the key and the second the corresponding values in the hash map. This is designed to fetch bulk data in the form of key value pairs. The primary use of this method is to fetch all the rows in the global_status and global_variables tables.

Parameters:
sql - The SQL to execute
Returns:
A hashmap of string pairs for the table
